Virgo Framework Overview

Virgo is a lightweight, beginner-friendly Python web framework inspired by Django. It follows a simple project structure and aims to help developers understand how web frameworks work under the hood â€” while still being powerful enough for real-world apps.

Virgo encourages learning by doing, making it ideal for students, hobbyists, and developers who want to explore web development beyond black-box magic.

Features

  • MVT-inspired structure - Follows a minimal Model-View-Template pattern.
  • Custom CLI - Use virgo.py to run your server or scaffold apps.
  • SQLAlchemy ORM - Write clean, Pythonic models using SQLAlchemy.
  • Jinja2 Templating Engine - Simple yet powerful templating engine for rendering HTML.
  • App System - Build apps inside a apps/ directory like in Django.
  • Routing system - Define routes using a clean Python dictionary.

Example Route

                    
# apps/blog/routes.py

from virgo.core.routing import routes
from virgo.core.response import Response, redirect
from virgo.core.template import render
from .models import Blog


def blog_app(request):
    blogs = Blog.all()
    return render("blog_app.html", {"blogs":blogs}, app="note")
routes["/"] = blog_app
